content.p: For each stage in the multistage sampling plan of this study, identify the sampling technique that was used.

body.p: 1) The research foundation identifies 5 large companies that represent a broad cross-section of patients, chooses 2 of the 5 at random, and gains access to the claims of all the companies' patients.

response.feedback: Correct. Two whole groups of patients (all the patients from two companies) were randomly selected.
Incorrect. Note that two whole groups of patients (all the patients from two companies) were randomly selected.
Incorrect. Note that two whole groups of patients (all the patients from two companies) were randomly selected.

body.p: 2) The 2 companies' claims are classified (depending on their origin) according to 7 geographical regions, and within each region, the sampling continues.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The claims are divided into groups/strata (regions), and then the sampling continues from within each such group. This is not cluster sampling, because no entire group was selected.
Incorrect. The claims are divided into groups/strata (regions), and then the sampling continues from within each such group.
Correct. The claims are divided into groups/strata (regions), and then the sampling continues from within each such group.

body.p: 3) From each region, 5 representative counties are selected. (In total, all the claims originating from 35 counties are examined.)

response.feedback: Correct. In this stage, whole groups of claims were selected. In particular, from each region, 5 groups of claims were selected (each group being all the claims originating from a certain county).
Incorrect. Note that not 5 individual claims were selected from each region, but rather 5 groups of claims, each group being all the claims originating from a certain county.

Incorrect. Note that in this stage, whole groups of claims were selected. In particular, from each region, 5 groups of claims were selected (each group being all the claims originating from a certain county).

body.p: 4) Within each county (and for each company), claims of 25 male and 25 female patients are randomly selected.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The claims are divided into groups/strata (by gender), and then 25 claims are chosen from each gender group. This is not cluster sampling, because no entire group was selected.

Not quite right. Although claims are eventually chosen using simple random sampling, the claims are first divided into groups/strata (by gender), and then the sampling continues from within each gender group.
Correct. The claims are divided into groups/strata (by gender). Note that after the claims are divided into strata, 25 claims are chosen from each gender group using simple random sampling.
